Description: Body sherd of North Ionian, probably Clazomenian, black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of hooved male animal grazing to right (part of lowered neck with added red, one foreleg and one hind leg, belly with red stripe and row of added white dots remaining); below, black with reserved band and one or more narrow red bands.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.15)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 23, pl. VIII, no. 7)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.260, no.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.041) (Phase 1)
